channel.title: Letting go when the product isn't working
channel.description:
I enjoyed this episode of https://roguestartups.com/ where Craig Hewitt discussed what it was like to accept that a product is not getting traction and to let go of it:
https://roguestartups.com/rs170-doubling-down-on-whats-working/
The topic in question starts at around 17:35
It is hard to decide when something isn't working, and when it just needs a bit more time, more polish, or more marketing.

item.title: Letting go when the product isn't working
item.dc:creator: daverodenbaugh
item.description:
Glad you enjoyed it! I know it was a hard one for Craig…he’s been thinking about it for awhile and it really weighs on you when something isn’t going somewhere and you really, really want it to and put the effort in, but nothing happens.

Read full topic
item.source: Letting go when the product isn't working

item.title: Letting go when the product isn't working
item.dc:creator: Paul1970
item.description:
Andy:

“even a pig can fly - with enough thrust”

Nice quote. Have to remember that.

Read full topic
item.source: Letting go when the product isn't working

item.title: Letting go when the product isn't working
item.dc:creator: Andy
item.description:
Paul1970:

Isn’t lack of traction always just bad marketing?

That is the “even a pig can fly - with enough thrust” approach. It is true that people have made a fortune with clever marketing of stuff that no-one needed. But much better to spend your energies on something that has a ready market IMHO.

Read full topic
item.source: Letting go when the product isn't working

item.title: Letting go when the product isn't working
item.dc:creator: Paul1970
item.description:
Isn’t lack of traction always just bad marketing? That’s what I was told once.

Read full topic

item.title: Letting go when the product isn't working
item.dc:creator: SteveMcLeod
item.description:
I enjoyed this episode of https://roguestartups.com/ where Craig Hewitt discussed what it was like to accept that a product is not getting traction and to let go of it:

RogueStartups – 24 Apr 19

RS170: Doubling Down on What's Working - RogueStartups

This week Dave and Craig catch up on their businesses after a few weeks without updates. Craig is looking forward to the end of the year to put together a SaaS specific founder retreat in Tuscany, Italy toward the end of the year. If anyone is...

The topic in question starts at around 17:35

It is hard to decide when something isn’t working, and when it just needs a bit more time, more polish, or more marketing.
